user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_FileSysStatVolume_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_FileSysStatVolume_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, OS_statvfs_t *result)
{
    OS_filesys_internal_record_t *local;
    struct statvfs                stat_buf;

    local = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_filesys_table, *token);

    if (statvfs(local->system_mountpt, &stat_buf) != 0)
    {
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    result->block_size   = OSAL_SIZE_C(stat_buf.f_bsize);
    result->blocks_free  = OSAL_BLOCKCOUNT_C(stat_buf.f_bfree);
    result->total_blocks = OSAL_BLOCKCOUNT_C(stat_buf.f_blocks);

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No pointer parameters are reassigned in this function. The parameters are:
- const OS_object_token_t *token: The code only dereferences *token when calling OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET; this reads the referenced object but does not modify the pointer parameter itself. The token pointer is not assigned to anywhere.
- OS_statvfs_t *result: The code writes to members of the object pointed to by result (result->block_size, result->blocks_free, result->total_blocks). MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 permits modification of the object referred to by a pointer parameter; it only forbids modifying the pointer variable itself. The result pointer is not reassigned.
All other assignments (local = ..., stat_buf, and calls) operate on local variables or objects not involving reassignment of the parameter pointers. Therefore there are no fragments that violate Rule 17.8 and nothing needs to be investigated for this rule.
